definition: degree of reduction (in prices, numbers etc)/decline/drop
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend

sentences.english: Imports were also lower by 25 percent - a sign the local economy remains weak.
sentences.chinese: 进口的降幅为25%，显示本国经济依然疲软。

sentences.english: The drop was often the equivalent of a 35- or 40-story building.
sentences.chinese: 降幅常常相当于35或40层楼那么高。

sentences.english: Only Scotland saw a single digit drop, falling by 6%.
sentences.chinese: 只有苏格兰的房价降幅保持在一位数之内其值为6%。

sentences.english: The largest loss in corn yields were in China and Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 玉米产量降幅最大的国家是中国和巴西。

sentences.english: Greece admitted to bigger-than-expected budget deficits.
sentences.chinese: 希腊承认降幅高于预期的预算赤字。

sentences.english: The average for all properties tracked by Trulia is only 10%.
sentences.chinese: 该公司跟踪的全部房产的平均降幅只有10%。

definition: to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
